message:
I want to take Software engineering and C++ courses. What is the best training center to take them ?
Could you guide me please ?

data.message: I wouldn't recommend you a " center " while there's what so called MOOCs existing on the internet for example : Coursera, Udacity, Pluralsight, EdX, MVA -- You can always refer to Google for more information about MOOCs.
I recommend you to take the trip as a self-study, there's a lot of free resources over the Internet that can help you reaching your goal...

That's for Software Engineering, What about C++ ?
Especially, I am lazy with self study :D

Look, here's my advice..
If you lazy and cannot work on your self day by day, i recommend you to leave software industry and change your career
Because our career is always updated with new technologies and if you can't adapt your self with the updates...you will have a big gap in your career and i can't tell you more...
You have to got it by your self ğŸ˜„

But I am talking about the new technologies, I am talking about the basis. 
Also, Interacting at training centers is very useful and that's what I am looking for.
Here is another point: Time :).
I am working, and almost have not time for self studying. 
and Many Thanks for your recommendations :)

We all didn't have enough time, and i think going to training centers will wasting your time , there's alot of video tutorials and courses over youtube and other gateways that will teach you everything you need 
We living in 2015
You can find and learn anything and every thing with out going out of your home ğŸ˜„

Anyways, it seems that you don't like training centers. C, C++, C#, ... are just tools to build your code.
So, learning a new tool with the help of someone is not that shame which I felt of your talking about this.
